column4: Anybody willing to offer some help smply installing ubuntu 9.10 server on a Compaq PPro 200 PC w/256MB RAM?
so I should use an older ubuntu on this PC?
No, you can totally use the current release.

1) I'd recommend the !alternate CD for installing, 2) You could even use the low-memory installation option, but at 256 I don't think you need it.  3) Consider using LXDE for your GUI instead of Gnome - you can get it by installing a minimal system first, and then 'apt-get install lubuntu-desktop'.
